post.body:
**Reblogged from: [hyggehaven](http://desireasflux.tumblr.com/post/178980312766/cant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden) on Tumblr. All links are clearnet.**

Can't afford to buy things for your garden?

_***R[e-posting](http://hyggehaven.tumblr.com/post/66604119797/cant-afford-store-bought-garden-supplies)**, with new information_

A store-bought bag of topsoil, a roll of landscaping fabric, or a bag of cedar chips doesn‚Äôt go very far if you have a large garden or a very limited budget. Here are some ways to create the materials you need for a beautiful, organic, productive garden, by both re-directing household waste, and foraging in your local area. I use a lot of these tricks in my garden to make it almost completely free for me to continue growing new things, and expanding the workable area every year!

# For soil

*   Save your food scraps to create a rich **compost** for growing veggies and amending your soil. There are numerous options for every size of dwelling and yard. Small space solutions such as [**Bokashi**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fen.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2FBokashi_composting%23Bokashi&t=NGQ1ZTljMGMyZWUyOWQxOTM5ZGNlNThiZTI4ZGI2YWQ3Y2Y1OGMwMSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1) and **[vermicompost](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fen.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2FVermicompost&t=YTJmOWM0MGVmMmU5MDk2N2EzOTg1ZGI3ODgzYTkxNTYxMDgyMWQwOSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)** work indoors and don‚Äôt produce bad smells, so you can keep them underneath the sink.**[Worm towers](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DyjOqv0JX5Vg&t=YWRmN2QyYjU4NTkyYzdlMzViYzI4MWZhN2VlYmUzZDQyZGM0YTJlOCwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)**, compost heaps, and **[outdoor compost bins](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.homedepot.ca%2Fknow-how%2Fprojects%2Feasy-composting&t=NWQyYTcwMjVkN2RjYTI2YjNhNzQ4OTFhYjgyZmI2YTlkZGNkMWJhNCwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)** are a great solution if you have more space. The more you add, the more rich, nutritious material you can make for your garden. I like composting because it means I don‚Äôt have gross smelly garbage bags to deal with, because food waste is diverted. It seems like a lot of work at first, but it actually saves time, money, and transportation.
*   [**Seaweed or kelp** is one of the best things for your garden, with over 70 essential nutrients, and acting as a weed barrier and a moisture-retentive mulch](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fforums.gardenweb.com%2Fforums%2Fload%2Ftomato%2Fmsg0216222224803.html&t=ZmJiNGMxMDBmNTUzMTljMDdiYzg0ZjczYzI5MWZjZDAzNGY4NWJkNSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1). I collect seaweed nearby on the beach with my bike trailer, or, when I go for a walk I bring a little home with me each time. It‚Äôs an absolute miracle for your soil.

![](https://66.media.tumblr.com/1df1516e435d897db3f91189963cc96e/tumblr_inline_p7kuzuEsFY1qmn4pu_540.jpg)

[_Worm tower_](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ecofilms.com.au%2Fhow-to-build-a-worm-tower%2F&t=ZmRiNGE5ZmY0YzBlOGY4NTYxMWMzMzViZmFmYThmYjU4YjI3NWFlYSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)

# Fertiliser

_There are three things that are essential for plant growth. These are [nitrogen](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fen.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2FNitrogen&t=ODM4MGVmOWQ3YTgyNDRhZThmOTQ3NjAzMzliMzRiNzI4YTY3NDFmOCwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1 "Nitrogen") for leaves and vegetation (N), [phosphorus](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fen.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2FPhosphorus&t=Nzg1NDg4YjhjMDMyYTY3NWQzMDY0NGY3MTNiNzA2YjQ3NjY0NjU0YiwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1 "Phosphorus") for roots and shoots (P), and [potassium](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fen.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2FPotassium&t=YmZmODk4YzZiMzVhNmE3NmNmMmM0YTQzY2Y0NjJmMzQ3M2ZhZDI2ZiwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1 "Potassium") for water movement, flowering, and fruiting (K). Commercial fertilisers will give the relative concentrations of each of these compounds with and ‚ÄúNPK‚Äù rating. Plants like tomatoes also need calcium to produce healthy fruit. You can create amendments for your garden and soil at home so that you do not have to purchase fertiliser._

## For nitrogen

*   [**Grass clippings**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fextension.missouri.edu%2Fp%2Fg6958&t=ZTk3M2NlOTljZTQ3NDJmMDBmMjcyZjIwNzYxMDJhMTY3YWY4NjkzMSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1) contain 4% nitrogen, 1% phosphorus, and 2% potassium (NPK = 4-1-2).
*   **Human urine** contains 12% nitrogen, and it‚Äôs sterile. Dilute before adding directly to plants.
*   [**Legumes**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fen.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2FLegume%23Nitrogen-fixing_ability&t=ODgyNTBlYzg1ZGQ1M2I1OWY5NzU1YjllODFmNDQyYzI5ZTg2ZmJkMSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1) such as beans, clover, peanuts, and alfalfa fix inorganic nitrogen into the soil with **[mycorrhizal](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fen.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2FMycorrhiza&t=ZTU3OTEwZDU4NGFjMDE1NTUwYTAwMGNlOTBlNTA3MDhlZTczNTIzOCwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)** organisms and nodules on their root systems. Plant these crops every few years in rotation with others to renew the soil organically.

## For phosphorus

*   [**Human urine**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.treehugger.com%2Flawn-garden%2Fp-is-for-phosphorus-as-well-as-human-urine.html&t=MDM5ZGY1M2M4ZTkyYzU2ODllYmViMzIyMDkyN2JkOTM3YjliMmJlNiwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1) is also a great source of phosphorous and trace amounts of potassium.
*   [**Ground up bones or shells**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.treehugger.com%2Fgreen-food%2Fhomemade-bone-meal-a-partial-solution-to-peak-phosphate.html&t=NTNmMTk0MGQzNzNjODdiM2NlOGI0OTYyNDQ4YzMxZmEwZDdjMjk1NCwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1) add a slow-release phosphorous to the soil
*   Had a baby recently? [**Bury the placenta in the garden**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.midwiferytoday.com%2Farticles%2Fbridgeoflife.asp&t=Mjk5NTJmMmRiMWY4OWQyZDIwZjM2NmFiODllOTZiM2QwNWFhOGMxMSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1).

## For potassium

*   [**Hardwood ashes**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.midwiferytoday.com%2Farticles%2Fbridgeoflife.asp&t=Mjk5NTJmMmRiMWY4OWQyZDIwZjM2NmFiODllOTZiM2QwNWFhOGMxMSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)
*   [**Composted banana peels**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.midwiferytoday.com%2Farticles%2Fbridgeoflife.asp&t=Mjk5NTJmMmRiMWY4OWQyZDIwZjM2NmFiODllOTZiM2QwNWFhOGMxMSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)

## For calcium

*   Break down all of your **eggshells**, or seashells you have found, in a plastic bucket, using vinegar. [This creates a soluble calcium solution you can add to a watering can.](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fforums.gardenweb.com%2Fforums%2Fload%2Ftomato%2Fmsg0216222224803.html&t=ZmJiNGMxMDBmNTUzMTljMDdiYzg0ZjczYzI5MWZjZDAzNGY4NWJkNSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)

# Soil Acidity/Alkalinity

_Many plants are particular about what the [**soil pH**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fen.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2FSoil_pH&t=ZjVmMWE3MzU4OGVhNjBmZTI5NzZkZDJiYjA2NTdlNDZjMTQ3ZDI1OCwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1) should be._

*   To make soil [more acidic](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.wikihow.com%2FAcidify-Soil&t=ODIwMDFjMDE5MzRmYzZmYzBjYTBhNjNmODJmMjU0OTU0Y2FjZDBmNSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1): add **oak leaves, pine needles, leaf mulch**, **urine, coffee grounds** or **sphagnum**.
*   To make soil [more alkaline](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.ehow.com%2Fhow_6691344_make-soil-alkaline.html&t=Y2ZjNDA4YjI4YWEyMTdlYTM4MzI5ZDI5NzdiYTJmMzhjZDA3MzI4ZiwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1): add **wood ash, shell,** or **bone**.

# Mulch

_Mulch is decomposing organic matter that adds nutrition to the soil, while simultaneously keeping out weed growth and retaining moisture. It also attracts worms, fungi and other beneficial creatures to your soil. Free sources of mulch include:_

*   **Leaves**
*   **Garden waste**
*   **Grass clippings**
*   **Straw** (often straw bales are given away after being used for decoration in the fall. You can also plant vegetables directly in straw bales using a technique called [**straw bale gardening**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fstrawbalegardens.com%2F&t=YTg5NDlkZGU3ZjU0MGY3ZWJhNDM3MmI2YzhlZDQ2MTNhZjEwOTRlMywxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)).
*   **Wood chips** (if you can borrow a wood chipper after you‚Äôve collected some wood you can have attractive wood mulch for free)

![](https://66.media.tumblr.com/93fd291c9370a3b2814015e54939782a/tumblr_inline_p7kuzu1s9Z1qmn4pu_540.jpg)

_[Straw bale garden](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.areyoubreathing.com%2F2012%2F06%2Fstraw-bale-garden.html&t=NGFkMDE3ZTBlZDM2NzBmODc2MDg1NGVjMWIzYzQxN2YzZWI0YWJmZCwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)_

# Landscaping fabric

_When mulch isn‚Äôt enough to keep the weeds down, many people opt for landscaping fabric. It can be quite expensive and inorganic-looking. Free solutions that both attract worms and can be replaced in small segments as they break down include:_

*   **Newspaper***
*   **Cardboard***
*   **Egg cartons***
*   **Printer paper, looseleaf, etc. in thick layers***

_*try to make sure you are using paper that has vegetable-based dyes, so you aren‚Äôt leeching toxins into the soil._

# Soil density/drainage

*   If your soil is compacted and you have plants that require low levels of water, or excellent drainage, add **sand**. I don‚Äôt recommend stealing it from the beach, but ask around and you‚Äôd be surprised at how easy it is to get for free. **Sawdust** also improves drainage. Adding organic matter and mulch encourages **worms**, who also till and aerate compacted soil.
*   If the area still needs drainage, dig a hole and fill it with bricks or rocks to create a ‚Äú[**dry well**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.wikihow.com%2FFix-Poor-Soil-Drainage&t=NjQ5Y2Y3ODdmODNjNDc4NzQzYjU1YWE1MzFiZGVjNzQ4MGQzNWJlNCwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)‚Äù
*   For drainage in pots, add **crushed bricks,** **terra cotta pot fragments, packing peanuts, small stones, marbles,** or**sand** to the bottom under the soil layer. I find these in construction sites, on craigslist, or at flea markets.

# Pots and growing containers

_If you have space, raised beds are a great no-dig way to establish growing space. If you are pressed for space (like working on a balcony) there are many cheap or free options for container gardens._

*   Creating **raised**** beds **allows you to build up the soil without digging. Free ways to do this include using** rocks **or** lumber **(like my [DIY ‚Äúlasagna garden‚Äù made with the sheet composting technique](http://hyggehaven.tumblr.com/post/66578197967/diy-raised-lasagna-bed-my-project-from-today)), using the ‚Äú[**wattle**]([https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3D-XyfWHMUY-A&t=ZDY2MTFjZWIwYzlhZDUyMDIwOTFkOTI3ZGZlMDYyNjZiNjdjYjNmYiwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)‚Äú](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3D-XyfWHMUY-A&t=ZDY2MTFjZWIwYzlhZDUyMDIwOTFkOTI3ZGZlMDYyNjZiNjdjYjNmYiwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)‚Äú) method with sticks and posts you have found, using** [discarded straw bales](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.ca%2Furl%3Fsa%3Di%26rct%3Dj%26q%3D%26esrc%3Ds%26source%3Dimages%26cd%3D%26cad%3Drja%26docid%3DmD03Ht9M37Gu3M%26tbnid%3DPSbvyPLgSbBovM%3A%26ved%3D0CAUQjRw%26url%3Dhttp%253A%252F%252Fborntofarm.com%252Fgyg-058-straw-bale-gardening-with-author-joel-karsten%252F%26ei%3D--1_UvyFMoPa4ASGlYH4BA%26bvm%3Dbv.56146854%2Cd.bGE%26psig%3DAFQjCNEegzRv93QIimX-o4wCy9zKNuvoMg%26ust%3D1384202095659775&t=YmRiNDE4N2QxMzFlZTUwNmE2NTBhODFjODQwN2QxMGRmMDZmY2RlNywxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1), old bricks**,**paving stones,cinder blocks** or really anything else you have lying around.
*   [**Hugelkutur raised beds**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.richsoil.com%2Fhugelkultur%2F&t=ZWVjNjZhZGEwZmZjMjg2MmIzMDlhZTZhOTUzYjFkODA2YzI1NzJmNywxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1), which fix carbon and provide drainage, can be made by stacking sticks and untreated wood, and then piling soil or compost over it. (Thanks [milos-garden](http://tmblr.co/mg70LnEp1C7DyHx5uA4Sf7Q))
*   [**Rubber tire gardens**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fcdn.homedit.com%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2012%2F04%2Fdiy-outdoor-planters-of-recycled-tires-1.jpg&t=YzZhZTk2ZGFkMmIyOWZhNjRlNjMyNmNmMzdkMDVhYWM1MTFhOTU5OSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1) retain heat in the night and allow for great drainage. They can also be painted in fun ways.
*   **Herb spirals** (here is mine: [1](http://hyggehaven.tumblr.com/post/56137565612/i-built-an-herb-spiral-kitty-corner-to-yesterdays), [2](http://hyggehaven.tumblr.com/post/56138012081/the-herb-spiral), [3](http://hyggehaven.tumblr.com/post/59781952335/herb-spiral-and-patio-firepit-progress-ive-put)) can be built with stones, bricks, and other found materials.
*   I often use old **cooking pots**, **barbecues**, **teapots**, or other found objects as planters.
*   [**Making wooden planters is easy,**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.gardenersworld.com%2Fhow-to%2Fprojects%2Fgarden-diy%2Fhow-to-make-a-wooden-planter%2F369.html&t=OGNkNmJlMGQ1ZmI4OTZkZGJkMzgyN2ZkZTAxZTQwM2RiZTBiYmI3ZSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1) and scrap or salvaged wood is also easy to come by. **[I‚Äôm not a fan of using wooden pallets for DIY projects](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.pallettruth.com%2F&t=ZDNiMTY1NjM0ZGNhZTk4Y2Y5YzJmMGZiMDljOGU0ZTNiYzU0MDNjNSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1),** but they are also a free source of lumber for things like planters.
*   If you can track down peat moss, cement, and vermiculite, you can make an easy [**Hypertufa planter**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.wikihow.com%2FMake-Hypertufa-Planters&t=YjNjMTYyYTY1ZTg0Mjg0MDI2NmI0YmEyZGY0NDE2ZDgyOTMyMDlmNiwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1) in whatever shape you would like, provided you have a form in which it can dry.
*   I‚Äôve made [**hanging gardens**](http://hyggehaven.tumblr.com/post/26940687124/pabst-garden-salad-herbs-spinach-basic) out of [**soda cans**](http://hyggehaven.tumblr.com/post/26940013194/arizona-nasturtium-taken-with-instagram).
*   You can build a [**self-watering container with a 2L pop bottle**](http://hyggehaven.tumblr.com/post/23758515556/self-watering-upcycled-tomato-pots-ingredients).
*   [**Start seeds in eggshells**](http://hyggehaven.tumblr.com/post/23747327485/a-sincere-attempt-at-seeding-in-eggshells)
*   Make **biodegradable pots** out of **[newspapers](http://hqcreations.tumblr.com/post/66807884489/irecyclart-how-to-make-biodegradable-pots).**

# Trellises and supports

_Many plants need external support, such as stakes of trellises, to thrive._

*   [**Rebar**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fen.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2FRebar&t=ZjBjNzg4YWFmZTM1NDZiZGMxOTQzYzExOTZlODFjNGRjMmRkNzQ0NywxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1) can almost always be salvaged cheaply or free and makes a great trellis, arch, or purgola
*   Build trellises and supports out of the **pliable young stems of plants like willow**

**![](https://66.media.tumblr.com/55144bb7077964ca3c74562c9518048d/tumblr_inline_p7kuzx67Py1qmn4pu_540.jpg)**

# Paving

_Paving often requires a foundation of sand or another stable and well-drained substrate, and a covering of stones, bricks, or other weatherproof elements. Slowly collect stones over time, or free paving stone fragments to create a mosaic-type walkway. Often people give these things away on craigslist. [I made a patio and fireplace out of free salvaged bricks, for example.](http://hyggehaven.tumblr.com/post/56138012081/the-herb-spiral)_

_![](https://66.media.tumblr.com/215e1484afa847bc94acb5062a906ec2/tumblr_inline_p7kuzxdPva1qmn4pu_540.jpg)_

_Salvaged garden walkway_

# Greenhouses and cold frames

*   Here is a gallery of greenhouses made out of [**salvaged windows and doors**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.inspirationgreen.com%2Fgreenhouses-made-from-old-windows-and-doors.html&t=M2NkMzRhNGU2YzNkOTdlYzU0MDkyMDgxY2UzYjdhYzgwYzVjYjM5MCwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)
*   A [**cold frame**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.treehugger.com%2Flawn-garden%2F3-easy-diy-greenhouses-under-300.html&t=NGFjNTBjNjY3MTc1YjhiNTk4Y2Y5ZDg1ODAwZjQzNDVkN2Y4ZDE4YywxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1) is easy to make with [salvaged lumber, and plastic sheeting](http://hqcreations.tumblr.com/post/66710898506/heefy-part-1-diy-recycled-pallet-cold-frame).

![](https://66.media.tumblr.com/a0f990c30bb535a30b13c48d5a6c60c0/tumblr_inline_p7kuzxsCTg1qmn4pu_540.jpg)

[_Window greenhouse_](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fdiysolargreenhouses.com%2Fenjoy-plants-year-round-with-a-window-greenhouse%2F&t=YmNjMmM5MTUwZWI1ZTNmMDc5OTJlMDhlYzlhNGE0ZGQ2ZDA5YjBhNywxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)

![](https://66.media.tumblr.com/3a2ce1a1ad1a4b0046cdee64807f32e3/tumblr_inline_p7kuzxrwMt1qmn4pu_540.jpg)

[_Palet cold-frame_](http://heefy.tumblr.com/post/65689203885/part-1-diy-recycled-pallet-cold-frame-today-i)

# Seeds and plants

*   **Swap seeds with other gardeners**
*   If you see a plant you like at someone‚Äôs house, **ask for seeds or cuttings**
*   **Save seeds** every year and build a library of options. [Here is a great guide to seed saving](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.organicgardening.com%2Flearn-and-grow%2Fsaving-seeds-for-next-season&t=MTYxZTZlYmI4MmUwNTE4ZjMxYmM4ZDM4ZmI0ZjIxMGVmNzZkNGNkMiwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1).
*   Save seeds from foods you like from the grocery store: consider growing **peanuts, ginger, garlic, peppers,** or a **walnut tree:** all of these and more can be planted from store-bought produce.
*   **Learn to take [cuttings](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fen.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2FCutting_%28plant%29&t=YmU5NTA1MzgyNjBlZTk1ZmFmNjkzOGVjMmEwYTU3ZmEzYTVjYmE2OSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)**. There is a tonne of info on the web about basic cutting propagation, **layering**, ([like I do with rhododendrons](http://hyggehaven.tumblr.com/post/66591095311/kihaku-gato-hyggehaven-layering-rooting)) [**air layering**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DeozrB950FFc&t=NDI0MWFiOWViMTE2YTFmMjgwZjFhMTQxMmI1MzYzNjFmNDk1NjllZCwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1), and numerous other techniques to take clones of plants you like. This saves going to a nursery and shelling out big bucks for all the variety you want.
*   For cuttings, [**willow tea**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DvZzxvt7T1CI&t=ZTk5M2VmODU0ZjI5N2ZkYjg2ZGRkOGEzMGMxOWY4ZTQzY2M2MGFhMSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1) and [**honey**](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.gardeningknowhow.com%2Fgarden-how-to%2Finfo%2Fhoney-root-hormone.htm&t=ZTEyNGQ2ZmU4MjRiZWQ0ZmQ4ZjhjZTU1MWRiY2JkZGY0YzVhOWQ4OSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1) are **great rooting hormones/antiseptics/anti-fungal agents**, which can save you $40 if you were thinking of buying commercial rooting hormone.
*   You can root cuttings in a potato! ([See my methods for rooting ‚Äúborrowed‚Äù plants here)](http://hyggehaven.tumblr.com/post/60195840216/my-combination-method-for-tree-cuttings-all-of)

![](https://66.media.tumblr.com/9c82111ad0586e1788d78cc38b6d1c17/tumblr_inline_p7kuzyzeQo1qmn4pu_540.jpg)

[_Air layering_](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fcommons.wikimedia.org%2Fwiki%2FFile%3AAir_layering_of_Ulmus_pumila_Faculty_of_Forestry_Belgrade_7.6.1986.jpg&t=NWMzYzYyY2E0M2U0MTQzODllNWRhMWFlN2I5YWYxOGU0MGFhZmNjNiwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)

_![](https://66.media.tumblr.com/691b92544280c64910553ea366e14261/tumblr_inline_p7kuzyuJoC1qmn4pu_540.jpg)_

_[Rooting cuttings in potatoes](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.amateurgardening.com%2Fhome%2Ftaking-rose-cuttings%2F&t=MzFkMWEzODQ1MTRjMzcyNzExZmJjYjc4MTJkNTNlZTc4Y2E0M2U1OSwxYWdFVDU3cQ%3D%3D&b=t%3AIE0U7aKoLCeGU6ROjrSfZw&p=http%3A%2F%2Fdesireasflux.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F178980312766%2Fcant-afford-to-buy-things-for-your-garden&m=1)_

‚Äî-

I hope this helps you build your garden outside of the usual capitalist channels! It can be a cheap or free hobby if you are willing to think outside the box, and maybe put up with things that don‚Äôt look as clean or crisp as a hardware store catalogue.

If you have any further ideas, please add them! The more information the better.

[![](https://66.media.tumblr.com/avatar_a4d755b6d239_64.pnj)](https://tmblr.co/mxoCSSDhF2XI8J4QO5CfdPw)[myrretah](http://myrretah.tumblr.com/post/170686790940)

post.body:

I came across an article today that detailed a bunch of trees and shrubs that are beneficial to butterfly and moth species that I wanted to share with you. These trees and shrubs are specifically beneficial to Missouri, so please check that they are not invasive species where you live before planting.

**Small Trees:¬†**(Up to 30 ft. tall)

**Downy Hawthorn -**¬†Beneficial to 150 different species

**Downy Serviceberry -**¬† Beneficial to 119 different species

**Flowering Dogwood -**¬† Beneficial to 150 different species

**Large Trees:¬†**(Up to 90 ft. tall)

**Shagbark Hickory -**¬† Beneficial to 200 different species

**Tulip Poplar -¬†**¬†Beneficial to 368 different species

**White Oak -**¬† Beneficial to 410 different species

**Shrubs:**

**American Hazelnut -**¬† Beneficial to 31 different species

**Arrowwood Viburnum -**¬† Beneficial to 104 different species

**Ninebark -**¬†Beneficial to 40 different species

**Other Beneficial Plants & Trees:**

Pin Oak

Rough- Leaved Dogwood

Oakleaf Hydrangea

Prairie Rose

Not only are the above mentioned trees and shrubs good for butterflies and moths, but they are also beneficial to song birds. An average chickadee clutch can eat 6,000-9,000 caterpillars before leaving the nest. Let‚Äôs also not forget that butterflies are pollinators and trees are carbon sinks. The benefits of planting a few shrubs or trees can be pretty big in the long run.

Trained trees have been around since at least Ancient Rome and were popular within the walled courtyards of castles. However others pinpoint the invention of trained trees to the 16th century in France and England where apple tree branches were bent horizontally to allow for more fruit production instead of height. You can train fruit trees into several different shapes that grow supported up walls or even into free-stranding living fences.

post.body:
[martymcdyke](http://martymcdyke.tumblr.com/post/168262418058/listen-i-know-you-all-think-im-obsessed-with):

> Listen I know you all think I‚Äôm obsessed with vampires and someone might tell me ‚Äúghani you can‚Äôt actually put vampires in everything‚Äù but fuck you ur not my mom so here‚Äôs my idea: solarpunk/lunarpunk with vampires??
> 
> How would vampires live in a more sustainable future? If they exist, will it mean that they have trouble surviving? Since their history is so greatly tied to decadence and a very romantic and sometimes bourgeois lifestyle, what would change about their aesthetic and their outlook in a far less or completely anti-capitalist society? How would humans view them?
> 
> I wanna write about this sooooo bad!

Sure vampires can like the finer things in life but look under the surface and you‚Äôll see not everything is what it seems. ‚ÄúAnd in their haste to vanquish nature by erasing the line between day and night, they ended up looking to nature as a guide. They looked up, seeking a model in the largest and most reliable source of nocturnal light they knew: the moon. And so, for a brief and literally shining moment early in the days of human-harnessed electricity, the future of municipal lighting was glowing orbs suspended high above cities ‚Äì towers, resembling oil derricks, capped with 4 to 6 [arc lamps](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fen.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2FArc_lamp&t=OWUxZWQ1ODhmMGZmNjQyZmNlOTU4ZTg1MDgxMWExMWExZjI3Njg3YyxLZE5kVEZUYw%3D%3D&b=t%3AnhRkDqkruKWZoA7CFtIcFA&p=https%3A%2F%2Fsolvoid-lunarpunk.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F179214356551%2Ftower-of-light-when-electricity-was-new-people&m=1) with [a candlepower of 2,000 to 6,000 each](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.lowtechmagazine.com%2F2009%2F01%2Fmoonlight-towers-light-pollution-in-the-1800s.html&t=OTc1OTcyN2EyNGEyMmFhZTkwYzA4OTEwMWQ3ODA4OWFkZjI0NjYyNSxLZE5kVEZUYw%3D%3D&b=t%3AnhRkDqkruKWZoA7CFtIcFA&p=https%3A%2F%2Fsolvoid-lunarpunk.tumblr.com%2Fpost%2F179214356551%2Ftower-of-light-when-electricity-was-new-people&m=1). These manmade moons made the ultimate promise to the people below them: that they would never again be in the dark.‚Äú

As Lunarpunks, we need to remember that while a lot of things have happened in the past hundred years or so, we still feel this need to light up the darkness. To shine a light on the unknown and possibly dangerous world around us and we‚Äôre just learning how destructive this urge can be with the deaths of pufflings, throwing off migratory bird patterns, and disrupting sea turtles reproductive patterns. It‚Äôs up to all of to help us to not only promote sustainable energy but to also to protect our night sky from light pollution and with a little work, perhaps the next hundred years will bring back the night sky while also allowing us the safety we so crave as human beings within that darkness.

post.title: Desert
post.body:
In desert environments Lunarpunks use the sunlight to their advantage to grow their food and conserve and recycle precious water. Underground homes are the norm with glass courtyards and green walls of kitchen herbs and veggies. Electricity is minimal as underground homes do not require heating nor cooling. Water is collected and recycled from the rainy months and offset by underground freshwater streams and Warka towers.

When the sands blow in they are sandblasted into sandstone homes and structures to prevent erosion. Wind turbines causing temperature sinks provide more rain. The soil is slowly being repaired over lifetimes. In the future man-made deserts of the past will be a vast oasis of plant life and fresh water rivers.

post.body: ![](https://78.media.tumblr.com/267359fae3f9ad50b530eb191ecdfa4c/tumblr_inline_pfvxhyidyp1t523on_540.jpg) I just started learning about time banks, but I‚Äôve already noticed a big issue‚Ä¶ They are not accessible to the chronically ill or disabled. Which is disheartening since their services are especially needed in those communities. The first issue with time banks is that they assume you are a healthy individual when you sign on and therefore can save your time credits for the future when you may become disabled or in your old age. This isn‚Äôt always the case and by assuming so, you leave out part of the community you should be including. This can be changed through putting accessibility guidelines into place, such as the following: - No fractions of an hour. Every bit of work rounds up to the nearest hour. Micro tasks are valued just the same as larger tasks. - Priority / time frame tags. - Assignment of a small amount of starter hours when registering for membership. - Digital services in addition to in person services for time credits. - Digital community services (newsletters, chatroom, calendar, skype meetings, podcasts, apps etc.) - Digital scheduling system for the community. - A possible voluntary one way time credit system. Where volunteers can donate credits back into the time back for redistribution to those who may need them during the month. A simple form could be filled out to apply for extra credits during a month. **Ex.)** You don‚Äôt have any credits but you need a ride to the hospital. If someone donated credits recently back to the time bank and you receive one, you can use it to find someone to drive you. **However, time banking should never been seen as the end goal for a community. Instead, it should be seen as a transitional tool** against our current capitalistic culture that values financial gain over the people it purports to serve. It allows us to reform and strengthen community bonds while also moving away from the illusion of money as the end goal to one of community as the end goal.

post.title: Lunarpunk Futures: Kitchens
post.body:
Kitchens that grow the food you eat; whether its fresh greens, algae lamps, kefir grains, sprouts, or freshly grown mushrooms.

Tea kettles that redirect steam to cook part of your meal.

You feed the coffee grounds from your shatterproof french press to your growing mushrooms.

Lights that don‚Äôt need to be plugged in or use bulbs because you rely on solar pot lights and bio-luminescent rods inspired by lightning bugs and bio-luminescent bacteria.

The electricity you do use is minimal and wind or solar powered.

Your pantry is stocked with package free lightweight shatter proof jars of bulk goods you picked up at your local market down the street, freshly dried herbs, diy pickled foods, and things you are storing for winter.

Your refrigerator holds separate compartments complete with sprouting trays, ice creation, water dispenser with charcoal filter, and cells of varying sizes to hang or chill certain veggies.

Your kitchen table does double duty with the middle section replaced with freshly growing plants.

Water is collected into a gray water system for reuse in your garden.

You do not have a traditional ‚Äòtrash‚Äô can. Instead, you have a bokashi system for veggie scraps that you put on your garden once a month to help your root veggies grow. Since items are completely reusable those things you do have never need to be recycled. You no longer require a bin in your kitchen. A small bin sits in your garage for things that will be repurposed or traded later instead.

People telling me to convince them that I‚Äôm right. If you respond in this way, I‚Äôm just going to say it, you look like an ass. Maybe you should learn to ask the right questions. Here‚Äôs some tips. **Before asking a question:** - Read the content again. - What is confusing? - Look up your question on a search engine for easily answerable questions. - Think about it. Can you rephrase it and figure out what the blogger meant? - Is this a question that might have been asked before? See if the blogger has a FAQ's page. - Ask the blogger for clarification or submit an ask. If it‚Äôs really important the blogger will update their post for clarity. - Feel an assumption coming on? Stop. Back away from your keyboard and repeat all the steps above. *If you want to comment on a blog post. Do not be combative. You waste everyone‚Äôs time when you slam a blogger‚Äôs piece without critically thinking about what the blogger meant in the first place.* Want to learn more, try reading:**[‚ÄúHow To Ask Questions The Smart Way‚Äù](https://t.umblr.com/redirect?z=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.catb.org%2Fesr%2Ffaqs%2Fsmart-questions.html&t=ODBlYjhjNmU3YTI5NjE1M2RmMWRjZjM4NzM4YWJiMDgwMmNhZjZiYSxjNjlmNzU1ZmYyMWUwYjkxYzE2YTM3NWY2OGUyMmIzODhlMThiZDVm)** by Eric Steven Raymond. P.S. It doesn‚Äôt matter if the writer/ blogger is right or wrong. Do not call them out on it until you have A. Checked the facts and B. Notified them privately first. At the very least. ‚Ä¶ Think about what you are doing. Not only are you removing the significance behind what they have written, posted, or shared. You are undermining their credibility. **On this blog, we don‚Äôt undermine anyone‚Äôs credibility for personal gain.**
